content: My dog Coco, shown on this morning's walk, recently had surgery to remove a small growth over her eye. While she was under anesthesia, the vet cleaned her teeth and trimmed her nails, which she won't allow otherwise. So, in true Los Angeles fashion, Coco has had her eyes done, teeth whitened and received a manicure. She does look fabulous, but may have let it go to her head as she's now requesting we dye her fur to hide the gray! ðŸ˜‚

content:
Following my move of @doomscrolltsk into the Fediverse, @axwax requested a "joybot" that regularly reminds us all to leave the timeline be for a bit, no matter how much fun it is here.

I have the techology (an easily adjustable NodeRED flow), so I'm happy to oblige, but I need messages for it!

So, for this #WholesomeWednesday I'm asking for friendly suggestions to regularly push to the bot's followers on what to do instead of endless scrolling on the fediverse.

Some 1st ideas below ðŸ§µ

#noxp

card.title: Nikodemus' Guide to Mastodon
card.description: Nikodemusâ€™ Guide to Mastodon by Nikodemus Siivola <@nikodemus@kamu.social>, updated 2022-11-02  If youâ€™re reading this, you probably have an invite to kamu.social - a server on the Mastodon network. If not, welp, hope this helps anyhow. Direct links wonâ€™t work for non-kamu-folks, but otherwise th...

content:
Food for thought: The bigger mastodon.social gets, the less successful the #fediverse is.

Sadly, the fundamental design of Mastodon mirrors the design of Big Tech (a server architecture that can support hundreds of thousands of â€œusersâ€) and thus inherits its success criteria.

I feel itâ€™s time we at least started thinking about what the web would look like if we all had our own place on it and what it would take to get there from here.

#decentralisation #centralisation #fediverse #SmallWeb

account.note:
I make small things.

#smallWeb #smallTech #web #tech #privacy #humanRights #personhood #democracy #aral #fedi22

fields.name: Me
fields.value: https://ar.al

fields.name: Small Technology Foundation
fields.value: https://small-tech.org

fields.name: Site.js
fields.value: https://sitejs.org

fields.name: Live Streams
fields.value: https://owncast.small-web.org

content:
We should not be optimising Mastodon so it can handle more people per server. We should be optimising Mastodon so it incentivises more serves with fewer people.

(And if you take that line of thinking to its logical conclusion, you arrive at the idea behind the Small Web: https://ar.al/2020/08/07/what-is-the-small-web/)

#decentralisation #federation #fediverse #SmallWeb

card.title: What is the Small Web?
card.description:
Today, I want to introduce you to a concept â€“ and a vision for the future of our species in the digital and networked age â€“ that Iâ€™ve spoken about for a while but never specifically written about:
The Small Web.
To understand what the Small Web is, letâ€™s compare it to the Big Web. In other words, to the centralised Web we have today.
The Big Web   You are allowed to rent space on Megacorpâ€™s servers in exchange for giving up your privacy, freedom of speech, and other human rights.

media_attachments.description: The Bargaining Committee won record-breaking raises in a six year contract, including compensation for work done outside of the classroom. A standard 4-credit course that was previously compensated at a minimum rate of $6,268.50 will now be compensated at $10,400, increasing to nearly $13,000 over the life of the agreement. Where university administration had previously devalued teaching artists and performers, the tentative agreement raises all boats, paying studio and performing arts instructors at the same rate as lecture courses by year three of the contract. With landmark pay increases across the full spectrum of adjunct instructors, NYU adjuncts now stand among the highest paid unionized contingent instructors in the nation.

content: And YES, I *do* understand this is another social network, with different techno-social accordances, communities of practice, rules of usage, and that it may not always be helpful to compare. I just wish the discourse on #Mastodon was a little bit less on how awful everything and everyone on #Twitter is (because I genuinely donâ€™t think itâ€™s the case, but I may be naive and as a white scholar, I have never been exposed to systemic racism, for instance).

account.note: research & teaching Uni Leipzig â€¢ alumna WiKo Greifswald â€¢ sociolinguistics â€¢ multilingualism â€¢ open science â€¢ acwri â€¢ blog: http://icietla.hypotheses.org â€¢ she/her â€¢ often with typos ðŸ™ˆ (yes, I know about the edit button!)

content:
This is how Eugen explains it btw: "it inevitably adds toxicity to people's behaviours". In my experience/timeline, this not "inevitably" so. Quoted tweets may pay compliments to the author of the initial tweet, add nuance, explain what is at stake, etc.

https://mastodon.social/@Gargron/99662106175542726

account.note: research & teaching Uni Leipzig â€¢ alumna WiKo Greifswald â€¢ sociolinguistics â€¢ multilingualism â€¢ open science â€¢ acwri â€¢ blog: http://icietla.hypotheses.org â€¢ she/her â€¢ often with typos ðŸ™ˆ (yes, I know about the edit button!)

card.title: Eugen ðŸ’€ (@Gargron@mastodon.social)
card.description: I've made a deliberate choice against a quoting feature because it inevitably adds toxicity to people's behaviours. You are tempted to quote when you should be replying, and so you speak at your audience instead of with the person you are talking to. It becomes performative. Even when doing it for "good" like ridiculing awful comments, you are giving awful comments more eyeballs that way. No quote toots. Thank's

content: #UnpopularOpinion: Today's thoughts on #Mastodon: I understand why the quote function doesn't exist, but I do think it's actually very useful. RT only (reboots in Mastodon) don't tell you anything about WHY the person highlights a post / WHAT is interesting about it. For me, this is a loss.

content: This clip from my IKEA sit/stand desk snapped, and my attempted repair with Sugru didn't last very long. The replacement part is always out of stock. It's not structural, just holds the winding arm out of the way when not in use. Is this the kind of thing it would be feasible to 3D-print? What tool should I use to model it?

content:
Hello! Time to do an updated #introduction. I've been here a while, and usually I make comics about happy trolls, and about angry widows. Currently I study data analytics because money has to come from somewhere. Here I toot my sketches, my adventures in animation, and about the account's _real_ star, Alea the Black Cat. I retoot interesting facts, art I like, and helpfull toots. Technically I'm also writing a book about Viking gardening.
#comics #art #DataAnalytics #animation

account.note: Comic artist, MoA

media_attachments.description: Alea the Black Cat looking up from a fold in a blue blanket.
The troll Ã„ngsull offering you a bouqet of roses she totally didn't steal from the iron pot behind her.

A drawing of a Viking Age guide pointing to a small, fenced off area behind him.
Guide: Here it is! We don't pray or sacrifice at this place, neither is it sacred to any god. This is the ONE mundane spot in the entire Uppland.
Onlookers: OOOOOOOOOOOH!
